In agile projects, key stakeholders, such as the acquirer or user representatives, are not just approvers of information, measurements, and evaluation reports. Continuous stakeholder involvement is consistent with this document, which identifies the involvement of stakeholders in every technical process as well as in the Tailoring process (Annex A). They are closely involved in requirements management (6.4.3.3.d) at each iteration, by bringing new requirements and changes in priorities and participating when prioritized requirements are selected from a backlog of undeveloped stories or functions and further refined for development.
